lines.text:
[to Tommy (who has been playing "jazz" violin)]
Excuse interruption of music festival, please, but would mind repeating excrutiating sound made with assistance of cat intestine?"
He who takes whatever gods send with smile has learned life's hardest lesson. I, personally, find it difficult to achieve that smile.

[Talking about Tommy]
Say, the boy has a head on his shoulders.
Oh, yes, even melon grown in shade will ripen in the end.

[Indicating the adjoining room]
Hey, look, you hide in here, so you'll absolutely be in possession of all the facts of this case.
You think it'll be all right?
Certainly.
Okay. This sounds like a very important case, and Pop needs all the help he can get. You can't expect him to solve everything alone.
He don't do bad that way.
If matter not solved, it is will of fate, but still feel inclined to give fate small tussle.

[to Tommy]
Nothing ventured; nothing overheard.

[Entering the room]
Captain...
Hello, Mr. Chan.
Charlie, I thought you were on your way to San Francisco.
Would have been had not been for appointment with Mr. LaFontaine. Trust am not late.
Late? I'm afraid you're too late . He died no more than five minutes ago.
Oh, death one appointment we must all keep and for which no time is set.
All cards should repose on table when personal liberty is at stake.
Mr. Chan, you oughta have all the credit for solvin' this case.

[Sardonically]
Well, after dinner is over, heh-heh, who cares about spoon?
Let's pack and go back to San Francisco, Pop.
Yes, wherever one is not, that's where heart is.

[to LaFontaine]
He who takes whatever God send with a smile has learned life's hardest lesson. I personally find it diafficult to achieve that smile. Heh-heh.
